pages.text_verbatim_title_block:
WADDELL ENGINEERING LTD.
104 STURGEON GLEN
KAWARTHA LAKES, ON
PROJECT: FLOATING SLAB
CLIENT: GARY GILES
DRAWING TITLE: NOTES, PLAN & SECTION(S)
DRAWN BY: CC DATE: 2005-01-14
SCALE: AS NOTED SHEET NO.: S1
PROJECT NO.: 25-01-070
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
FOUNDATIONS:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. SLAB MUST BE CARRIED DOWN TO NATURAL, UNDISTURBED SOIL CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING 1500 PSF (75 KPA) PRESSURE UNDER PART OF OR 300 PSF (15 KPA) UNDER STRUCTURAL SLAB. LOCAL BEARING PRESSURE 1500 PSF (75 KPA).
3. IF FILL IS TO BE BUILT UP, GRANULAR 'F' IS TO BE USED TO ACHIEVE DESIGN GRADE.
4. IF FILL IS USED, COMPACTION TO BE SUPERVISED BY GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER.
5. ENGINEERING SURVEYOR TO PROVIDE FINISHED GROUND ELEVATION AND FOUNDATION LINE SURVEY PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION.
6. ENGINEERING SURVEYOR, IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING OVER TIME (IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED) (NO HEAT LOSS OF BUILDING HEAT).
7. IF RETAINING WALLS ARE NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING OVER TIME.
8. BRICK VENEER: BRICK VENEER MAY BE USED UP TO A MAXIMUM OF 4' OF ABOVE SLAB. CLIENT CONTRACTOR TO CONFIRM SLAB DIMENSIONS BEFORE ORDERING MATERIAL & CONSTRUCTION.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE ON THIS PROJECT SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 20 DAY COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 20 MPA WITH AIR ENTRAINMENT AND 0.4 W/C MAX WATER/CEMENT RATIO.
2. ALL REINFORCEMENT TO BE GRADE 400W.
3. REBAR SPLICE LENGTH 30M WITH 1 LAP = 40"
4. WELDED WIRE MESH 6x6/6x6 W1.4 W1.4
5. CONCRETE WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE NATIONAL BUILDING CODE OF CANADA & CSA A23.1-23.2 AND LOCAL BY-LAWS.
6. CONCRETE COVER SHALL BE:
   a) 2" WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS)
   b) 1" WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH FORMS (I.E. SIDE OF FLOATING SLAB)
7. SLAB TO BE MINIMUM 100 MM THICK OR GRANULAR 'A' FILL COMPACTED TO 95% SPD; ON COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A'.
8. SAWCUT SLAB TO A DEPTH OF SLAB THICKNESS (1"). SPACE SAW CUTS @ 15' o.c.
9. SLAB IS NOT TO BE POURED ON FROZEN GROUND.
10. SLAB IS TO BE POURED MONOLITHICALLY AT ONE TIME.
11. SUMP PITS RECOMMENDED FOR ALL UTILITY CONNECTIONS.
REVIEW OF FLOATING SLABS:
IF REVIEW OR SIGN...
pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a mixed set of drawings and notes for a floating slab foundation. It includes a plan view of the floating slab with dimensions of 26' x 30', and a section view showing the thickened edge detail. The general notes cover foundation preparation, concrete specifications, and construction requirements. Key components include the floating slab and thickened edge, with detailed instructions for concrete work and slab installation.
